alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 1:26PM CST until January 12 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...TORNADO EMERGENCY FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOSA COUNTY... ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOSA COUNTY... At 126 PM CST, a confirmed large and destructive tornado was located over Nixburg, or near Equality, moving northeast at 50 mph. TORNADO EMERGENCY for SOUTHEASTERN COOSA COUNTY. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Deadly tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Nixburg, Cottage Grove, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Western Lake Martin, Fishpond and Ray. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous, and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If in a mobile home, a vehicle or outdoors, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
